result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larell Mitchell

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 1:24pm 
Defendant Larell Mitchell appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD appears for bond-purposes only; Mr. Mitchell does not currently qualify though his custody status may change this).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel is given.  The Court indicates that Mr. Mitchell should fill out the petition form to request the appointment of counsel.  The Court directs the clerk to provide a blank petition form with the bond-paperwork that is sent over to the Jail. 
The Court tolls time limits and schedules the case for status-of-counsel hearing.

The Court requires a $1,500 Signature Bond with conditions:
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 1:32pm. 

NEXT: (1) add the Jefferson County Jail to the mailing matrix--Mr. Mitchell is currently on a DOC hold,  (2) Adjourned Initial Appearance (and status-of-counsel hearing) on November 10th at 1:30pm
